revised_title: The Analysis of Randomized Experiments with Orthogonal Block Structure
tldr: The authors present a unified treatment of the analysis of experimental designs with an orthogonal block structure, which includes randomized blocks, Latin squares, Graeco-Latin squares, split plot designs, and more. They introduce a notation for simple block structures and explain how to derive the randomization theory, covariance matrix, and expectations of mean squares in the null analysis of variance from the block structure formula.
